doc.previous: Usually when involving some sort of potential the wavefunction is decomposed into a superposition of energy eigenstates each oscillating with frequency of Thus we may write
doc.after: The eigenstates have a physical meaning further than an orthonormal basis When the energy of the system is measured the wavefunction collapses into one of its eigenstates and so the particle wavefunction is described by the pure eigenstate corresponding to the measured energy
